ygData.subject: Re: Digest Number 25
ygData.msgSnippet: In a message dated 5/23/99 11:34:13 PM Pacific Daylight Time, ... Ah so according to you any guy that plays a female character is either gay or a transvestite?
ygData.messageBody:
In a message dated 5/23/99 11:34:13 PM Pacific Daylight Time,
warriors_eq@onelist.com writes:

> > Speaking of women.....There is one big question I have.....why do guys
> > play girl characters....some say they are role playing.....do they also
> > dress up in womens close and role play women in real life? or is "role
> > playing" a female the first step towards role playing a real life female?

Ah so according to you any guy that plays a female character is either gay or
a transvestite? I guess you really can't fight ignorance.

There are quite a few reasons to play a female character, although admittedly
they are all matters of taste. First off, many of the female figures look
much better than the male ones (I say that partly because I'm a guy who likes
the look of a woman). Secondly, who's to say that females can't be just as
much an action/adventure hero as much as a male? Myself and several friends
of mine all have female characters in our rosters because sometimes one gets
tired of running all male characters all the time. Female characters should
have the chance to represent just like anybody else. Thirdly, the decision
to play a female is no different from any other character generation choice.
Why did you decide to play that dark elf, or human, or barbarian? Why did
you decide to play that warrior, or enchanter, or shadowknight? Because you
thought you'd try something new, right? Does playing a wizard mean that you,
in real life, practice magic spells? Of course not. Does playing an orge
mean, in real life, you wish you were an 8-foot tall ugly and monsterous
humanoid? I certainly hope not.

> > I know there are a lot of legitimate female players, but I'd bet a large
> > sum of money that most of the female characters are being driven by
> > guys.....call me homophobic if you will, but I think its weird.

Well of course! Duh! I bet that most of the players in Norrath are male,
period, regardless of what they play! In general, computer games and
role-playing games have much more of a draw for men than they do for women.
Ever go to a game store with open space for gaming? How many women do you
see hanging out compared to the guys?

Finally, be aware that I'm not attempting to change your opinion. You play
what you like to play and that's great. I just think you should be more
open-minded and relax. It is just a game, after all.
